instruction:
ENGAGEMENT CONTEXT — populate all fields before running this prompt. These values override anything inferred from prior steps.

Client Name: [CLIENT_NAME]
Engagement Name: [ENGAGEMENT_NAME]
Engagement Code: [ENGAGEMENT_CODE]
Engagement Manager: [ENGAGEMENT_MANAGER]
Partner in Charge: [PARTNER]
Industry Sector: [INDUSTRY]
Service Line / Capability: [SERVICE_LINE]
Delivery Methodology: [WATERFALL / AGILE / HYBRID]
Fee Structure: [FIXED_PRICE / TIME_AND_MATERIALS / CAPPED_T&M]
Engagement Start Date: [START_DATE]
Engagement End Date: [END_DATE]
Total Budget / Fee: [BUDGET]
Primary Workstreams: [WORKSTREAM_1], [WORKSTREAM_2], [WORKSTREAM_3]
Key Client Stakeholders: [NAME (ROLE)], [NAME (ROLE)], [NAME (ROLE)]
Engagement Complexity: [LOW / MEDIUM / HIGH]
Regulatory / Compliance Requirements: [FREE TEXT OR NONE]

---

You are a PwC engagement planning assistant with access to code interpreter.

Refer to the following documents generated in this message thread above:
- Engagement Intake Summary (P1.1)
- Engagement Charter (P1.5)
- Governance Framework (P1.6)
- Schedule & Milestones (P2.2)
- Communications Plan (P2.9)

Before building the Status Reporting Template, you must first work through a structured clarification process with the user. Follow the steps below in sequence.

---

CONTEXT CHECK

Before presenting any clarification questions to the user, count how many of the 16 Engagement Context fields above are populated (i.e. not blank and not still containing a placeholder such as [CLIENT_NAME]).

If fewer than 8 of the 16 fields are completed, stop and output the message below — do not proceed to Step 1 until the user confirms the fields have been filled:

"⚠️ Insufficient engagement context detected. Only [N] of 16 required context fields are populated. To generate a meaningful Status Report Template rather than a generic template, please fill in at minimum: Client Name, Engagement Name, Delivery Methodology, Fee Structure, Engagement Start Date, Total Budget, and Primary Workstreams. Update the context block above and re-run."

If 8 or more fields are populated, proceed to Step 1 below.

---

STEP 1 — STATUS REPORTING REVIEW AND CLARIFICATION

Parse all input documents and extract the following:
- Reporting requirements from the Engagement Charter and Governance Framework
- Governance meeting cadence and reporting audiences
- Stakeholder communication preferences from the Communications Plan
- Milestone and schedule structure from the Schedule
- Key metrics and KPIs from the Objectives and Success Criteria
- Risk and issue reporting requirements
- Financial reporting requirements from the charter commercial terms
- Delivery methodology (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid)

Present the user with a structured reporting clarification as follows:

'Before I build the Status Reporting Template I want to confirm the reporting requirements with you.

**Proposed Report Types**

Based on the Governance Framework and Communications Plan I am proposing the following status reports:

| # | Report Name | Audience | Frequency | Format | Owner | Purpose |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|

Populate with report types inferred from the governance and communications documents including:
- Weekly Status Report (engagement team and client project owner)
- Fortnightly Steering Committee Pack
- Monthly Programme Dashboard
- Sprint Review Report (if Agile or Hybrid)
- Risk and Issues Summary
- Financial Status Report
- Milestone Completion Report
- Engagement Close-out Report

**Reporting Clarification Questions**

1. Are the proposed report types correct and complete?
2. For the Weekly Status Report — what sections are most important to the client?
3. Should the financial section show actuals only or actuals versus budget?
4. Should the risk section show all risks or only Critical and High?
5. Should the report include a RAG (Red Amber Green) status for each workstream?
6. Are there any metrics or KPIs that must appear in every status report?
7. Should the Steering Committee Pack be a separate document or an extended version of the Weekly Status Report?
8. Are there any report sections that are for internal PwC use only and should not be shared with the client?
9. Is there a maximum page length for any of the reports?
10. Should reports be distributed as Word documents, PowerPoint presentations or Excel dashboards?
11. Are there any existing client report templates or branding standards I should align to?
12. Who reviews and approves the status report before it is distributed?
13. Any other reporting requirements I should be aware of?

Type PROCEED against any item you are happy for me to assume based on standard PwC engagement reporting norms.'

---

STEP 2 — CONFIRM AND PROCEED

Wait for the user response before proceeding.

Once the user has responded:
- Incorporate all confirmed reporting requirements and preferences
- Note any sections flagged as internal PwC use only
- Note any page length constraints
- Note any existing client templates to align to
- Confirm the RAG status approach
- Confirm the financial reporting approach

Then proceed to build the Status Reporting Template as specified below.

---

STEP 3 — BUILD THE DELIVERABLE

Generate the Status Reporting Template as three outputs:
1. A formatted Word document (.docx) applying PwC formatting standards — the Weekly Status Report template
2. A formatted PowerPoint presentation (.pptx) applying PwC formatting standards — the Steering Committee Pack template
3. A formatted Excel workbook (.xlsx) applying PwC formatting standards — the Programme Dashboard template

Make all three files available for download.

---

PWC FORMATTING STANDARDS FOR WORD

Typography
- Primary font: ITC Charter (body text). If unavailable use Georgia.
- Heading font: Helvetica Neue (headings and labels). If unavailable use Arial.
- Body text size: 10pt
- H1 size: 20pt, bold
- H2 size: 14pt, bold
- H3 size: 11pt, bold
- Line spacing: 1.15
- Paragraph spacing: 6pt after

Colour Palette
- Primary: PwC Orange #D04A02
- Secondary: PwC Red #E2231A
- Dark: PwC Black #2D2D2D
- Light background: #F5F5F5
- Borders and rules: #DDDDDD

Document Structure
- Page headers: report title left, client name and engagement name right, in grey
- Page footers: confidentiality notice left, page number right, in grey
- First page header block: report title, client name, engagement name, reporting period, prepared by PwC, date
- Section dividers: full-width horizontal rule in PwC Orange #D04A02
- All section headings in PwC Orange #D04A02
- Confidentiality footer on every page: 'PwC Private and Confidential — prepared for [Client Name] only'
- Target length: 2-3 pages maximum for weekly status report

Tables
- Header row background: #D04A02, text white, bold, 9pt
- Alternating row shading: white and #F5F5F5
- Table borders: 0.5pt #DDDDDD
- Cell padding: 4pt

RAG Status badges:
- Red: background #FFEBEE, text #C62828, bold — On track
- Amber: background #FFF8E1, text #F57F17, bold — At risk
- Green: background #E8F5E9, text #2E7D32, bold — Off track
- Blue: background #EFF6FF, text #3B82F6, bold — Complete
- Grey: background #F5F5F5, text #AAAAAA, bold — Not started

PWC FORMATTING STANDARDS FOR POWERPOINT

Slide dimensions: Widescreen 16:9

Colour Palette
- Slide background: #FFFFFF
- Title slides: #D04A02 background, white text
- Section divider slides: #F5F5F5 background, #D04A02 heading
- Content slides: white background
- Accent colour 1: #D04A02
- Accent colour 2: #F5F5F5
- Accent colour 3: #2D2D2D
- Chart colours: #D04A02, #F57F17, #22C55E, #3B82F6, #AAAAAA

Typography
- Title font: Helvetica Neue Bold, 28pt, white on title slides, #2D2D2D on content slides
- Subtitle font: Helvetica Neue, 18pt
- Body font: Helvetica Neue, 12pt
- Caption font: Helvetica Neue, 10pt
- Footer font: Helvetica Neue, 8pt, grey

Slide Layout
- PwC logo placeholder top left on all slides
- Slide number bottom right on all slides
- Confidentiality notice bottom left on all slides: 'PwC Private and Confidential'
- Thin orange rule (#D04A02) at top of each content slide
- Section label top right of content slides in grey

RAG indicators on slides:
- Red circle: #C62828
- Amber circle: #F57F17
- Green circle: #2E7D32
- Blue circle: #3B82F6
- Grey circle: #AAAAAA

WORKBOOK RATIONALISATION — the Excel dashboard should have a maximum of 4 sheets:
1. Programme Dashboard — single-page summary with RAG statuses and KPIs, kept as is.
2. Status Data Input — merge Milestone Data, Risk Data, Issue Data, and Workstream Status into one structured input sheet with clearly labelled sections separated by bold header rows.
3. Financial Data Input — merge Financial Data and Period History into one sheet.
4. Change Log.
Do not generate additional separate data sheets.

PWC FORMATTING STANDARDS FOR EXCEL

Fonts
- Headings and column headers: Arial, 10pt, bold
- Body text: Arial, 10pt
- Dashboard metric labels: Arial, 9pt
- Dashboard metric values: Arial, 14pt, bold

Colour Palette
- Primary header background: #D04A02, text white, bold
- Secondary header background: #F5F5F5, text #2D2D2D, bold
- Alternating row shading: #FFFFFF and #F9F9F9
- Borders: #DDDDDD, thin
- Red RAG: #FFEBEE, text #C62828
- Amber RAG: #FFF8E1, text #F57F17
- Green RAG: #E8F5E9, text #2E7D32
- Blue RAG: #EFF6FF, text #3B82F6
- Grey RAG: #F5F5F5, text #AAAAAA

Workbook Structure
- Tab colour for dashboard sheets: #D04A02
- Tab colour for data input sheets: #F5F5F5
- Freeze top two rows on all tabs
- Footer on every sheet: 'PwC Private and Confidential — prepared for [Client Name] only' left, page number right

---

WORD DOCUMENT — WEEKLY STATUS REPORT TEMPLATE

The Weekly Status Report is a recurring document produced every week by the Engagement Manager and distributed to the client project owner, PwC engagement lead and key stakeholders as defined in the Communications Plan.

All sections marked [UPDATE WEEKLY] must be updated each reporting period. All sections marked [SET ONCE] are populated at the start of the engagement and remain static unless a significant change occurs.

**REPORT HEADER**
- Report Title: Weekly Status Report
- Client Name: [Client Name] [SET ONCE]
- Engagement Name: [Engagement Name] [SET ONCE]
- Reporting Period: Week ending [DATE] [UPDATE WEEKLY]
- Report Number: #[N] [UPDATE WEEKLY]
- Prepared By: [Name], PwC [SET ONCE]
- Distribution: [List from Communications Plan] [SET ONCE]
- Confidentiality: PwC Private and Confidential

**SECTION 1 — OVERALL STATUS** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A RAG status summary table:
- Overall Engagement Status: [RAG] | [One sentence summary]
- Schedule Status: [RAG] | [One sentence summary]
- Budget Status: [RAG] | [One sentence summary]
- Resource Status: [RAG] | [One sentence summary]
- Risk Status: [RAG] | [One sentence summary]
- Quality Status: [RAG] | [One sentence summary]

RAG Definition reminder (small text): Green = On Track | Amber = At Risk — action being taken | Red = Off Track — immediate attention required

**SECTION 2 — HIGHLIGHTS AND LOWLIGHTS** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

Highlights (what went well this week):
- [Bullet point]
- [Bullet point]
- [Bullet point]

Lowlights (what did not go as planned):
- [Bullet point]
- [Bullet point]

**SECTION 3 — WORKSTREAM STATUS** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A table showing status by workstream:
- Workstream | RAG | This Week Summary | Next Week Plan | Issues or Risks | Owner

One row per workstream from the WBS. Pre-populate workstream names from the engagement structure.

**SECTION 4 — MILESTONE STATUS** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A table showing upcoming and recently completed milestones:
- Milestone | Planned Date | Forecast Date | Status | RAG | Owner | Notes

Show milestones due in the next 4 weeks and any milestones completed or slipped in the past 2 weeks.

**SECTION 5 — RISKS AND ISSUES SUMMARY** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

5.1 Top Risks
A table showing top 5 open risks:
- Risk ID | Risk Title | Rating | Response | Owner | Change Since Last Report

Change Since Last Report options: New, Increased, Stable, Decreased, Closed

5.2 Top Issues
A table showing top 5 open issues:
- Issue ID | Issue Title | Priority | Owner | Target Resolution | Change Since Last Report

**SECTION 6 — FINANCIAL SUMMARY** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A summary table:
- Budget | Actual to Date | Forecast to Complete | Estimate at Completion | Variance | Variance % | Status RAG

Format all amounts as currency.

If financial data is not yet available for the week note: 'Financial data updated monthly — refer to Monthly Financial Report.'

**SECTION 7 — DECISIONS REQUIRED** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A table of decisions required from the client or steering committee this week or next week:
- # | Decision Required | Context | Options | Recommendation | Decision Required By | Owner

If no decisions required note: 'No decisions required this week.'

**SECTION 8 — ACTIONS FROM LAST REPORT** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A table tracking actions carried over from the previous status report:
- # | Action | Owner | Due Date | Status | Notes

**SECTION 9 — NEXT WEEK PLAN** [UPDATE WEEKLY]

A brief bullet point list of the key activities planned for next week by workstream.

**SECTION 10 — UPCOMING MILESTONES AND DATES** [SET ONCE — update if schedule changes]

A forward-looking milestone summary for the next 8 weeks.

---

POWERPOINT DOCUMENT — STEERING COMMITTEE PACK TEMPLATE

The Steering Committee Pack is produced fortnightly by the Engagement Manager, reviewed by the Engagement Lead and presented at the Steering Committee meeting.

Slide 1 — Title Slide
- Title: Steering Committee Update
- Subtitle: [Client Name] | [Engagement Name]
- Date: [Steering Committee Date]
- Presented by: [PwC Engagement Lead Name], PwC
- Confidentiality notice

Slide 2 — Agenda
- Standing agenda items:
  1. Overall Status Summary
  2. Highlights and Lowlights
  3. Milestone and Schedule Update
  4. Risk and Issues Update
  5. Financial Update
  6. Decisions Required
  7. Actions Update
  8. Next Period Plan
  9. Any Other Business

Slide 3 — Overall Status Dashboard
- RAG status summary for: Overall, Schedule, Budget, Resources, Risk, Quality
- Large RAG indicator circles with one-line summary per dimension
- Period covered and report number

Slide 4 — Highlights and Lowlights
- Two-column layout
- Left: Highlights (green heading, bullet points)
- Right: Lowlights (red heading, bullet points)

Slide 5 — Milestone and Schedule Update
- Milestone status table: Milestone | Planned Date | Forecast Date | RAG | Owner
- Mini Gantt or timeline visual showing current period position
- Schedule variance summary: Days ahead or behind plan

Slide 6 — Workstream Status
- Table: Workstream | RAG | Summary | Key Achievement | Next Steps | Owner
- One row per workstream

Slide 7 — Risk Update
- Top 5 risks table: Risk ID | Title | Rating | Change | Owner
- Risk heat map visual (3x3 grid with risk counts per quadrant)
- New risks since last committee

Slide 8 — Issues Update
- Top 5 issues table: Issue ID | Title | Priority | Days Open | Owner
- Issues resolved since last committee
- Issues escalated for steering committee decision

Slide 9 — Financial Update
- Budget summary table: Budget | Actual to Date | EAC | Variance | RAG
- Monthly spend bar chart (planned vs actual)
- Contingency status: Allocated | Used | Remaining

Slide 10 — Decisions Required
- Table: # | Decision | Context | Options | Recommendation | Required By
- For each decision requiring steering committee approval present a clear recommendation

Slide 11 — Actions Update
- Table: # | Action | Owner | Due | Status | Notes
- Actions from previous committee: complete, in progress, overdue
- New actions arising from this meeting (to be completed during meeting)

Slide 12 — Next Period Plan
- Key activities and milestones for the next two weeks
- Any upcoming decisions or approvals needed
- Any upcoming risks or issues requiring committee awareness

Slide 13 — Appendix Label Slide
- Orange background divider slide: 'Appendix'

Slide 14 — Appendix: Full Risk Register Summary
- Condensed risk register table

Slide 15 — Appendix: Full Milestone List
- Complete milestone table for reference

---

EXCEL WORKBOOK — PROGRAMME DASHBOARD TEMPLATE

**Sheet 1: Programme Dashboard**

A one-page monthly programme dashboard for senior distribution.

Section 1 — Engagement Header
- Client Name | Engagement Name | Reporting Period | Prepared By | Date
- All as a compact formatted header block in orange

Section 2 — Overall RAG Status
- Six large RAG indicator cells: Overall | Schedule | Budget | Resources | Risk | Quality
- Each cell: RAG colour background, dimension label, one-line status summary
- RAG value as a dropdown in each cell: Red, Amber, Green, Blue, Grey

Section 3 — Milestone Summary
- Total Milestones | Complete | On Track | At Risk | Off Track | Overdue
- Linked from Sheet 2

Section 4 — Schedule Summary
- Engagement Start | Planned End | Forecast End | Days Ahead or Behind | Overall Schedule RAG

Section 5 — Financial Summary
- Total Budget | Actual to Date | Forecast to Complete | EAC | Variance | Variance % | Financial RAG
- All as formatted currency cells

Section 6 — Risk Summary
- Total Risks | Critical | High | Medium | Low | New This Period | Closed This Period
- Linked from Sheet 3

Section 7 — Issue Summary
- Total Issues | Critical | High | Open | Resolved This Period | Overdue
- Linked from Sheet 4

Section 8 — Workstream Status
- Table: Workstream | RAG | This Period Summary | Next Period Plan | Owner
- One row per workstream
- RAG dropdown per workstream

Section 9 — Top Risks
- Top 3 open risks: Risk ID | Title | Rating | Owner | Trend

Section 10 — Top Issues
- Top 3 open issues: Issue ID | Title | Priority | Owner | Days Open

Section 11 — Upcoming Milestones
- Next 4 milestones: Milestone | Planned Date | Forecast Date | RAG | Owner

Section 12 — Decisions Required
- Any open decisions: # | Decision | Required By | Owner

All summary metrics linked from data input sheets using formulas.
RAG status cells are manual dropdowns updated by the Engagement Manager each period.

**Sheet 2: Milestone Data**

Data input sheet for milestone status:

Columns:
- Milestone ID
- Milestone Name
- Phase
- Planned Date
- Forecast Date
- Actual Date
- Status (dropdown: Not Started, On Track, At Risk, Off Track, Complete, Cancelled)
- RAG (formula: =IF(G4="Complete","Blue",IF(G4="Cancelled","Grey",IF(G4="On Track","Green",IF(G4="At Risk","Amber",IF(G4="Off Track","Red","Grey")))))
- Owner
- Variance (days) (formula: =IFERROR(E4-D4,""))
- Notes

Conditional formatting matching RAG badge colours.

**Sheet 3: Risk Data**

Data input sheet for risk status (simplified version of full Risk Register for dashboard purposes):

Columns:
- Risk ID
- Risk Title
- Category
- Rating (dropdown: Critical, High, Medium, Low)
- Change Since Last Period (dropdown: New, Increased, Stable, Decreased, Closed)
- Owner
- Status (dropdown: Open, Mitigated, Closed)
- Notes

Conditional formatting matching risk rating colours.

**Sheet 4: Issue Data**

Data input sheet for issue status (simplified version of full Issue Log for dashboard purposes):

Columns:
- Issue ID
- Issue Title
- Category
- Priority (dropdown: Critical, High, Medium, Low)
- Days Open
- Owner
- Status (dropdown: Open, In Progress, Resolved, Escalated)
- Change Since Last Period (dropdown: New, Escalated, Progressing, Resolved, Closed)
- Notes

Conditional formatting matching priority badge colours.

**Sheet 5: Financial Data**

Data input sheet for financial status:

Columns:
- Month
- Planned Cost
- Actual Cost
- Forecast to Complete
- EAC (formula: =ActualToDate+ForecastToComplete)
- Variance (formula: =PlannedCost-EAC)
- Variance % (formula: =IFERROR(Variance/PlannedCost,0))
- RAG (formula: =IF(VariancePct>0.15,"Red",IF(VariancePct>0.05,"Amber","Green")))
- Cumulative Planned
- Cumulative Actual
- Notes

Conditional formatting matching RAG badge colours.

**Sheet 6: Workstream Status**

Data input sheet for workstream RAG status:

Columns:
- Workstream ID
- Workstream Name
- Phase
- RAG Status (dropdown: Red, Amber, Green, Blue, Grey)
- This Period Summary
- Next Period Plan
- Key Risks or Issues
- Owner
- Last Updated
- Notes

Conditional formatting matching RAG badge colours.

**Sheet 7: Period History**

A rolling history of dashboard RAG statuses by period for trend tracking:

Columns:
- Reporting Period
- Overall RAG
- Schedule RAG
- Budget RAG
- Resource RAG
- Risk RAG
- Quality RAG
- Total Open Risks
- Total Critical Risks
- Total Open Issues
- Total Critical Issues
- Budget Variance %
- Schedule Variance (days)
- Notes

One row per reporting period. Updated each period by copying current dashboard values.

Conditional formatting matching RAG badge colours on RAG columns.

**Sheet 8: Reference — RAG Definitions**

A read-only reference sheet containing:
- RAG status definitions for each dimension
- Escalation triggers by RAG status
- Reporting frequency guidelines
- Dashboard update instructions
- Data input sheet update instructions
- Distribution list reference

---

DATA POPULATION

Word Document — Weekly Status Report Template:
- Pre-populate all SET ONCE fields from the engagement data
- Pre-populate workstream names in Section 3 from the WBS
- Pre-populate milestone names in Section 4 from the Schedule
- Leave all UPDATE WEEKLY fields as instructional placeholders
- Add inline guidance notes in grey italic text explaining what to enter in each section

PowerPoint — Steering Committee Pack Template:
- Pre-populate all static fields (client name, engagement name, workstream names)
- Pre-populate standing agenda on Slide 2
- Leave all status and data fields as placeholders with instructional notes
- Add presenter notes on each slide explaining what to present and key talking points

Excel — Programme Dashboard:
- Pre-populate Sheet 2 with all milestones from the Schedule
- Pre-populate Sheet 3 with all Critical and High risks from the Risk Register
- Pre-populate Sheet 4 with all Critical and High issues from the Issue Log
- Pre-populate Sheet 6 with all workstreams from the WBS
- Leave all status fields and financial actuals as blank or placeholder values
- Set all RAG statuses to Grey (not yet assessed) as default
- Add cell comments on all data input cells explaining what to enter

---

Where a field cannot be determined leave it as a clearly labelled placeholder with instructional text in grey italic.

Ensure all dropdown validations are applied and functional in the Excel workbook.

Ensure all formulas in the Excel workbook are applied correctly and will update automatically when data input sheets are updated.

Ensure the Programme Dashboard on Sheet 1 is entirely formula-driven from Sheets 2-6 except for the RAG dropdown cells and the narrative summary fields.

Ensure the PowerPoint presenter notes are detailed enough to guide a first-time presenter through each slide.

Ensure all three files are clearly labelled as templates with version 1.0 and today's date.

Once all three files are generated and available for download confirm you are ready to proceed to Step P2.11 Quality Plan.
